summary.p: The Kantapurāṇam is one of the major Tamil texts about the god Skanda/Murukaṉ. It is the work of Kacciyappa Civācāriyār (14th century?).

The text is incomplete. The manuscript contains: Pāyiram, Uṟpattikkāṇṭam, Acurakāṇṭam (up to Tikkuvicayap Paṭalam, verse 66, itself incomplete) in U3; Makēntirakāṇṭam, Viravāku Kantamātaṉañ Cel Paṭalam (up to verse 8, itself incomplete) in U4. Note that the Tikkuvicayap Paṭalam is not named as such in the manuscript, but is divided into 3 chapters: Kupēraceyap Paṭalam (U3, f161r, lm), Akkiṉiceyap Paṭalam (U3, f163r, lm), Yamaṉ Ceyap Paṭalam (U3, f164r, lm).

extent.note: Some folios are smaller, e.g. U3, f105 (365 x 35 mm).

collation.desc: 3 folios = front guard leaves. No foliation.
164 folios = Kantapurāṇam: Mūlam (up to Makēntirakāṇṭam, Tikkuvicayap Paṭalam). Tamil foliation 1‒164.
1 folio = Kantapurāṇam: Mūlam (beginning of Makēntirakāṇṭam, Vīravāku Kantamātaṉañ Cel Paṭalam). No foliation.
6 folios = back guard leaves. No foliation.

supportDesc.condition: Palm-leaf. Excellent state of preservation. Very few bore holes caused by insects.

binding.p: Original bamboo woodcovers. The number "2" is engraved in the middle of the front woodcover.

origin.origDate: No internal date. Before 1855, as it is part of Ariel’s bequest made in that year to the Société Asiatique, Paris (Rosny 1869).

acquisition.p: Received, August 1st, 1866, from the Société Asiatique. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 7 = Dons: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1895, no. 1192.

provenance.p: Owned by Édouard Ariel (1818-1854). Bequested by Édouard Ariel to Société Asiatique (Rosny 1868, p. 177).

listBibl.bibl: Cabaton, Antoine (1912). Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 48.
Rosny, Léon de (1868). La bibliothèque tamoule de M. Ariel, de Pondichéry. In: Variétés orientales (pp. 177‒224). Paris: Maisonneuve.
